raw_text:
IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF TALLAPOOSA COUNTY, ALABAMA
ALEXANDER CITY DIVISION
CHRISTOPHER BLAINE MCGREGOR )
)
PLAINTIFF )
)
v. ) CASE NO. DR-2023-900051.01
)
BRITTANY MICHELLE GILLILAND )
)
DEFENDANT )
REQUESTS FOR ADMISSIONS
Comes now the Plaintiff/Father, Christopher Blaine McGregor, by and through his
attorney of record, Dianne James Davis, and submits the following Requests for Admissions, to
be answered by the Defendant/Mother, Brittany Michelle Gilliland, in the manner and form
prescribed by law:
1) Admit or deny that you contacted Dr. Tyler or his staff to cancel A.K.’s behavior
appointment that was scheduled prior to reunification therapy with Kelly Turner
being ordered.
2) Admit or deny that you scheduled a reunification session with Kelly Turner on the
same date as A.K.’s behavior appointment with Dr. Tyler.
3) Admit or deny that you and your father, Mike Wright, went to the school to pick
up the minor children in August 2025, after the Court had issued an order on
Plaintiff’s Motion to Clarify.
4) Admit or deny that you and your father, Mike Wright, have caused a scene at the
minor child, B.M.’s school.
5) Admit or deny that you and your father, Mike Wright, attempted to physically
remove the minor child, B.M., from the Father, while they were walking to their
vehicle.
Submitted this the 16th day of September, 2025.
+/s/Dianne James Davis
Dianne James Davis (DAV007)
Attorney for Plaintiff/Father
107 Main Street
Alexander City, AL 35010
(256) 392-3172
(256) 392-3578 (facsimile)
dianne@diannedavislaw.com
Certificate of Service
I hereby certify that I have served a copy of the foregoing upon the following via the
AlaCourt E-File System and/or by electronic transmission on this the 16th day of September,
2025.
Barbara H. Agricola
127 South 8th Street
Opelika, AL 36801
/s/Dianne James Davis
Of Counsel
